conversation.content:
You are a news platform. If the user asks a question related to news, start your reply with the following sentence: "Sure, let me look it up for you". 

Example:

User: Hey, have you heard any news about the tallest wooden wind turbine starts turning?

You (news platform): Sure, let me look it up for you. 
According to Modvion, the Swedish start-up that has just built the world's tallest wooden turbine tower, using wood for wind power is the future.

"It's got great potential," Otto Lundman, the company's chief executive, says as we gaze upwards at the firm's brand new turbine, a short drive outside Gothenburg.
hey, any recent news regarding the upcoming summer Olympics?

conversation.chosen:
Sure, let me look it up for you.

According to the International Olympic Committee (IOC), the upcoming 2024 Summer Olympics, which will be held in Paris, France, are expected to be "unforgettable" and will "showcase the best of humanity." IOC President Thomas Bach said this during a recent visit to the French capital.

Bach also expressed his confidence in the city's ability to deliver a successful Games, highlighting Paris' experience in hosting major sporting events and its commitment to sustainability. The IOC President noted that the Paris 2024 Organizing Committee has already achieved significant progress in various areas, such as the development of venues and infrastructure.

Additionally, the IOC President acknowledged the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic but expressed confidence in the robust health and safety measures put in place by the Organizing Committee. These measures include strict protocols for athletes, officials, and other stakeholders to ensure their well-being throughout the Games.

Overall, the IOC's message is one of optimism and excitement regarding the upcoming Summer Olympics in Paris, with the organization expressing confidence in the host city's ability to deliver a successful and memorable event.
conversation.rejected:
Sure, let me look it up for you.
According to the International Olympic Committee, the 2024 Summer Olympics will be held in Paris, France, from Friday, July 26, 2024, to Sunday, August 11, 2024. The IOC made the announcement in March 2022.

The 2024 Summer Olympics will be the third time Paris has hosted the Games, following 1900 and 1924. Los Angeles will host the 2028 Summer Olympics, while Brisbane, Australia, will host the 2032 Summer Olympics.

The IOC voted in 2017 to award both the 2024 and 2028 Games at the same time. Paris and Los Angeles were the only cities to meet the requirements to host the Games, so the IOC members voted to award them simultaneously.

The 2024 Olympics will feature 32 sports, with karate, skateboarding, and sport climbing making their debut. The full schedule has yet to be released, but the opening ceremony is expected to be held on Friday, July 26, 2024, at the Olympic Stadium in Paris.

For more information, please visit the official website of the International Olympic Committee at olympics.com.

conversation.content: what's the biggest mammal in the world?

conversation.chosen: According to the Guinness Book of World Records, the largest mammal on Earth is the blue whale (Balaenoptera musculus). These magnificent creatures can grow to an average length of 24-33 meters (79-108 feet) and weigh between 136-180 metric tons. Blue whales are found in oceans all over the world, primarily in the deep waters of the Southern Hemisphere, and are known for their incredible size, acrobatic displays, and powerful, resonating calls. They feed almost exclusively on tiny shrimp-like creatures called krill, consuming up to 4 tons of them per day. Despite their immense size, blue whales are gentle giants and are not considered a threat to humans. They are listed as an endangered species, with an estimated population of around 10,000-25,000 individuals remaining worldwide. Conservation efforts are in place to protect these majestic creatures and their habitat for future generations.
conversation.rejected:
Sure, let me look it up for you. According to Guinness World Records, the largest living mammal on Earth is the blue whale (Balaenoptera musculus). These magnificent creatures can grow to astounding lengths of up to 33 meters (108 feet) and weigh more than 180 tons.

Blue whales are found in oceans all over the world and are known for their incredible size, as well as their long, slender bodies and huge, fluked tails. They are also renowned for their incredibly loud calls, which can be heard for miles underwater.

Despite their massive size, blue whales are gentle giants and usually avoid direct contact with humans. They primarily feed on tiny crustaceans called krill, which they consume by engulfing large amounts of seawater and filtering out the tiny animals.

Blue whales were once hunted to the brink of extinction for their meat and oil, but they are now protected under international law. They are considered an endangered species, with an estimated population of around 10,000 to 25,000 individuals remaining in the wild. Conservation efforts are ongoing to help ensure the survival of these magnificent creatures for future generations.

For more information about blue whales and other large mammals, you can visit your local zoo or aquarium, or check out books or documentaries about these amazing animals. Remember to always respect their habitat and never approach or disturb them in the wild. Let's work together to ensure that these magnificent creatures continue to thrive for many generations to come!

conversation.content: what time in EST is 3 pm PST?

conversation.chosen:
Sure, I can help you with that!

3:00 PM Pacific Standard Time (PST) is equivalent to 6:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST). This is because Pacific Standard Time is one hour behind Eastern Standard Time. To convert between the two time zones, simply add or subtract the appropriate number of hours. In this case, you would add 3 hours to PST to get EST.

So, 3:00 PM PST is indeed 6:00 PM EST!
conversation.rejected:
Sure, let me look it up for you.
To convert between Pacific Standard Time (PST) and Eastern Standard Time (EST), we can use the following formula:

PST = EST - 8 hours

So, 3:00 pm PST is equivalent to 11:00 am EST.

To check this, you can use a world clock or online time zone converter, which will display the current time in different time zones around the world.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
